DOCNAME: CASE OF NAİME DOĞAN AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in different cities in GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicants’ predecessor , Mr PERSON Doğan , was the owner of a plot of land in PERSON . On DATE he filed an action with ORG against certain third persons , whom he claimed were unlawfully occupying his land . He requested that the allegedly unlawful interference be halted .

CARDINAL . As cadastral work by the authorities started in the area in DATE , the court decided on CARDINAL DATE that it no longer had jurisdiction and transferred the case to a court with special jurisdiction in the subject , ORG ( PERSON ) in PERSON .

CARDINAL . The cadastral work divided the land into CARDINAL parcels , the ownership of which was separately disputed between the applicants’ predecessor and the occupiers . In DATE , ORG joined all CARDINAL cases .

CARDINAL . NORP Throughout the proceedings , the applicants’ predecessor on the one hand maintained that the new plots corresponded to the single piece of land already registered in his name . The defendants , on the other hand , claimed that the land records could not possibly relate to those plots as they had purchased the whole piece of land in dispute from its previous , lawful owner .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ruled in favour of the applicants’ predecessor and ordered the CARDINAL parcels to be registered in his name .
CARDINAL . On DATE , however , ORG quashed this judgment on the grounds that there had been an insufficient factual examination of the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG resumed the proceedings . On DATE it decided to abide by ORG decision . Accordingly , it conducted a broader factual examination .

CARDINAL . Notwithstanding that decision , the same court held a hearing on CARDINAL DATE and scheduled a new hearing to decide ( apparently for a second time ) whether or not to abide by ORG ruling .
CARDINAL . At the next hearing held on DATE , ORG gave a fresh decision to abide by ORG ruling .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE hearings were held DATE . However , several hearings were presided over by different judges .
CARDINAL . At the hearing on DATE , the court decided to conduct an on - site inspection ( keşif ) on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE a new judge was appointed to the court for the second time in DATE . As he was unfamiliar with the case , he postponed the inspection . Until DATE , the judge sitting on the bench of the court was changed CARDINAL more times and the hearings were mainly devoted to the new judges’ gaining familiarity with the dispute .

CARDINAL . Despite the fact that the court scheduled an on - site inspection several times , it was deferred for various reasons , including the lack of the necessary court stamps in the court ’s registry to notify experts and witnesses , the parties’ failure to pay certain fees , the applicants’ failure to bring their witnesses to the inspection site , the parties’ mutual failure to attend the inspection , the judge ’s DATE leave , the lack of pertinent witnesses , unsuitable weather conditions , the ailing condition of a local witness , the court ’s search for suitable new witnesses , the court ’s shortage of time due to its hearing backlog and , finally , the GPE disorderly behaviour and contempt of court . Throughout this process , the judge presiding over the case was again changed CARDINAL times .
CARDINAL . The re - scheduled on - site inspection was eventually conducted on DATE .

CARDINAL . At the hearing on DATE , the parties submitted their final observations . From that date until DATE , the court held a total of CARDINAL hearings . At the hearing held on that last date , ORG dismissed the ORG request .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed . ORG held a hearing on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld ORG judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a petition with ORG in PERSON , to be submitted to ORG , and requested the rectification of the decision dated DATE on the ground that the latter court had rendered a decision which lacked legal and procedural reasoning . According to the applicant ’s letter dated DATE , the proceedings are still pending before ORG .
